verses.kjv: Then verily the first covenant had also ordinances of divine service, and a worldly sanctuary.
verses.ct: Now the first covenant did have regulations for worship and an earthly sanctuary.

verses.kjv: For there was a tabernacle made; the first, wherein was the candlestick, and the table, and the shewbread; which is called the sanctuary.
verses.ct: A tabernacle was constructed. In the outer room there was the lampstand, the table, and the consecrated bread. This section was called the Holy Place.

verses.kjv: And after the second veil, the tabernacle which is called the Holiest of all;
verses.ct: Behind the second curtain was the inner room known as the Most Holy Place.

verses.kjv: Which had the golden censer, and the ark of the covenant overlaid round about with gold, wherein was the golden pot that had manna, and Aaron’s rod that budded, and the tables of the covenant;
verses.ct: This room contained the golden altar of incense and the ark of the covenant, which was completely covered in gold. Inside the ark were the golden jar of manna, Aaron's staff that had sprouted, and the stone tablets of the covenant.

verses.kjv: And over it the cherubims of glory shadowing the mercyseat; of which we cannot now speak particularly.
verses.ct: Above the ark were the cherubim of glory, overshadowing the mercy seat. But we can't go into all these details right now.

verses.kjv: Now when these things were thus ordained, the priests went always into the first tabernacle, accomplishing the service of God.
verses.ct: Once everything was arranged this way, the priests regularly entered the outer room to carry out their duties of worship.

verses.kjv: But into the second went the high priest alone once every year, not without blood, which he offered for himself, and for the errors of the people:
verses.ct: But only the high priest entered the inner room, and only once a year, and never without blood, which he offered for his own sins and for the sins the people had committed in ignorance.

verses.kjv: The Holy Ghost this signifying, that the way into the holiest of all was not yet made manifest, while as the first tabernacle was yet standing:
verses.ct: The Holy Spirit was making it clear through this arrangement that the way into the Most Holy Place had not yet been revealed as long as the outer tabernacle was still functioning.

verses.kjv: Which was a figure for the time then present, in which were offered both gifts and sacrifices, that could not make him that did the service perfect, as pertaining to the conscience;
verses.ct: This was an illustration pointing to the present time. The gifts and sacrifices being offered under that system were unable to clear the conscience of the worshiper.

verses.kjv: Which stood only in meats and drinks, and divers washings, and carnal ordinances, imposed on them until the time of reformation.
verses.ct: They dealt only with food, drink, various ceremonial washings, and external regulations that were in effect until the time when God would set things right.

verses.kjv: But Christ being come an high priest of good things to come, by a greater and more perfect tabernacle, not made with hands, that is to say, not of this building;
verses.ct: But when Christ arrived as the high priest of the good things that have now come, he passed through the greater and more perfect tabernacle — one not built by human hands, meaning not part of this created world.

verses.kjv: Neither by the blood of goats and calves, but by his own blood he entered in once into the holy place, having obtained eternal redemption for us.
verses.ct: He did not enter by means of the blood of goats and calves. Instead, he entered the Most Holy Place once for all through his own blood, securing eternal redemption for us.

verses.kjv: For if the blood of bulls and of goats, and the ashes of an heifer sprinkling the unclean, sanctifieth to the purifying of the flesh:
verses.ct: After all, if the blood of bulls and goats, and the ashes of a young cow sprinkled on those who are ceremonially unclean, can make them outwardly pure,

verses.kjv: How much more shall the blood of Christ, who through the eternal Spirit offered himself without spot to God, purge your conscience from dead works to serve the living God?
verses.ct: then how much more will the blood of Christ — who through the eternal Spirit offered himself as a flawless sacrifice to God — cleanse your conscience from useless rituals so that you can serve the living God?

verses.kjv: And for this cause he is the mediator of the new testament, that by means of death, for the redemption of the transgressions that were under the first testament, they which are called might receive the promise of eternal inheritance.
verses.ct: This is why he is the mediator of a new covenant. Since a death has taken place that redeems people from the violations committed under the first covenant, those who are called can receive the promised eternal inheritance.

verses.kjv: For where a testament is, there must also of necessity be the death of the testator.
verses.ct: In the case of a will, the death of the person who made it must be established.

verses.kjv: For a testament is of force after men are dead: otherwise it is of no strength at all while the testator liveth.
verses.ct: A will only takes effect after the person dies. It has no power at all while the one who made it is still alive.

verses.kjv: Whereupon neither the first testament was dedicated without blood.
verses.ct: That is why even the first covenant was not put into effect without blood.

verses.kjv: For when Moses had spoken every precept to all the people according to the law, he took the blood of calves and of goats, with water, and scarlet wool, and hyssop, and sprinkled both the book, and all the people,
verses.ct: After Moses had announced every commandment of the law to all the people, he took the blood of calves and goats along with water, scarlet wool, and hyssop, and sprinkled both the scroll and all the people.

verses.kjv: Saying, This is the blood of the testament which God hath enjoined unto you.
verses.ct: He said, 'This is the blood of the covenant that God has commanded you to keep.'

verses.kjv: Moreover he sprinkled with blood both the tabernacle, and all the vessels of the ministry.
verses.ct: In the same way, he sprinkled blood on the tabernacle and on every piece of equipment used in worship.

verses.kjv: And almost all things are by the law purged with blood; and without shedding of blood is no remission.
verses.ct: Under the law, nearly everything is purified with blood, and without the shedding of blood there is no forgiveness.

verses.kjv: It was therefore necessary that the patterns of things in the heavens should be purified with these; but the heavenly things themselves with better sacrifices than these.
verses.ct: So it was necessary for the copies of the heavenly realities to be purified with these sacrifices, but the heavenly realities themselves required far better sacrifices.

verses.kjv: For Christ is not entered into the holy places made with hands, which are the figures of the true; but into heaven itself, now to appear in the presence of God for us:
verses.ct: Because Christ did not enter a sanctuary built by human hands — which was only a copy of the real one. He entered heaven itself, where he now stands in the presence of God on our behalf.

verses.kjv: Nor yet that he should offer himself often, as the high priest entereth into the holy place every year with blood of others;
verses.ct: He did not enter to offer himself again and again, the way the high priest enters the Most Holy Place every year with blood that is not his own.

verses.kjv: For then must he often have suffered since the foundation of the world: but now once in the end of the world hath he appeared to put away sin by the sacrifice of himself.
verses.ct: If that were the case, he would have had to suffer repeatedly since the creation of the world. Instead, he has appeared once for all at the culmination of the ages to eliminate sin through the sacrifice of himself.

verses.kjv: And as it is appointed unto men once to die, but after this the judgment:
verses.ct: Just as each person is destined to die once, and after that comes judgment,

verses.kjv: So Christ was once offered to bear the sins of many; and unto them that look for him shall he appear the second time without sin unto salvation.
verses.ct: so Christ was offered once to take on the sins of many. He will appear a 2nd time — not to deal with sin — but to bring salvation to those who are eagerly waiting for him.
